definition: can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works

sentences.english: Professionalizing social work is needed to build harmonic community in Henan.
sentences.chinese: 河南省社會工作職業化是構建和諧河南的需要。

sentences.english: In the value system of legal social work, the key idea is humanitarianism.
sentences.chinese: 在法律社會工作價值體系中，其核心理念是人道主義。

sentences.english: Level-2 Scholarship on Social Works (amount of prize: RMB 500).
sentences.chinese: 社會工作優秀二等獎，獎金爲500元。

sentences.english: The female surrogate was a registered nurse with a master's in social work.
sentences.chinese: 這個女性代理人是註冊護士，是社會工作方面的專家。

sentences.english: Level-1 Scholarship on Social Works (amount of prize: RMB 800).
sentences.chinese: 社會工作優秀一等獎，獎金爲800。

sentences.english: Shanghai began the Practice in the anti-drug social work in 2003.
sentences.chinese: 上海自2003年開始進行禁毒社會工作制度創新。

sentences.english: The following information is provided by Instituto de Accao Social and posted by Student Affairs Section.
sentences.chinese: 以下資訊由澳門社會工作局提供，學生事務處代傳。

definition: making an all-out effort (idiom); to try one's heart out/to do one's utmost
practice (customary action, as opposed to theory)/practical
(Tw) to draw on (others' experience)/to learn from (how others do things)/lesson to be learned (by observing others)
student of a senior high school
with great prospects for the future (idiom); well worth doing
to offer advice/to make a suggestion
